Package ohos.event.commonevent

Class CommonEventSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.event.commonevent.CommonEventSupport

  • public class CommonEventSupport
extends Object
    Provides a series of static system-level constants of common events.

    You need to use these constants as the input values of action when you call Intent.setAction(String) in CommonEventData#CommonEventData(Intent) to set the common event content to be published, or when you call MatchingSkills#addEvent(String) in CommonEventSubscribeInfo#CommonEventSubscribeInfo(MatchingSkills) to set the filter criteria for subscribing to common events.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    Intent.setAction(String)
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Notification#CES

    • Field Detail

      • COMMON_EVENT_ABILITY_ADDED

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_ABILITY_ADDED
        Indicates the action of a common event that an ability has been added.

        To subscribe to this common event, your application must have the ohos.permission.LISTEN_BUNDLE_CHANGE permission. This is a protected common event, which can be sent only by the system.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMMON_EVENT_ABILITY_REMOVED

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_ABILITY_REMOVED

        To subscribe to this common event, your application must have the ohos.permission.LISTEN_BUNDLE_CHANGE permission. This is a protected common event, which can be sent only by the system.

      • COMMON_EVENT_ACCOUNT_DELETED

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_ACCOUNT_DELETED
        Indicates the action of a common event that the account is deleted.

        To subscribe to this common event, your application must have the ohos.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS permission. This is a protected common event, which can be sent only by the system.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMMON_EVENT_AIRPLANE_MODE_CHANGED

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_AIRPLANE_MODE_CHANGED
        Indicates the action of a common event that the airplane mode of the device has changed.

        By subscribing to this common event, your application will be notified every time the user turns on or off the airplane mode of the device.

        Your application can use the value of state to determine airplane mode state. The value true indicates that the airplane mode is turned on, and false indicates that it is turned off.

        This common event can be triggered only by system applications.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMMON_EVENT_BATTERY_CHANGED

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_BATTERY_CHANGED
        Indicates the action of a common event that the charging state, level, and other information about the battery have changed.

        This common event can only be published by the system.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMMON_EVENT_BATTERY_LOW

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_BATTERY_LOW
        Indicates the action of a common event that the battery level is low.

        This common event can only be published by the system.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMMON_EVENT_BATTERY_OKAY

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_BATTERY_OKAY
        Indicates the action of a common event that the battery exit the low state.

        If a device enters a low battery state, COMMON_EVENT_BATTERY_LOW is published. After the battery is charged and enters a normal state, COMMON_EVENT_BATTERY_OKAY is published. This common event can only be published by the system.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMMON_EVENT_BLUETOOTH_A2DPSINK_AUDIO_STATE_UPDATE

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_BLUETOOTH_A2DPSINK_AUDIO_STATE_UPDATE
        Indicates the action of a common event that the audio state of Bluetooth A2DP Sink has changed.

        Indicates the action of a common event that the NFC RF field is detected to be in the enabled state.

        To subscribe to this common event, your application must have the ohos.permission.MANAGE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission. This is a protected common event, which can be sent only by the system.

      • COMMON_EVENT_WIFI_CONN_STATE

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_WIFI_CONN_STATE
        Indicates the action of a common event that the Wi-Fi connection state has changed. You can register this common event to listen for Wi-Fi connection state changes.

        In this common event sent to you, the WifiEvents.PARAM_CONN_STATE key of the IntentParams key-value pair carries specific information about the Wi-Fi connection state change, and the value can be WifiEvents.STATE_DISCONNECTED (Wi-Fi disconnected) or WifiEvents.STATE_CONNECTED (Wi-Fi connected).

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        WifiEvents.PARAM_CONN_STATE, WifiEvents.STATE_DISCONNECTED, WifiEvents.STATE_CONNECTED, Constant Field Values

      • COMMON_EVENT_WIFI_HOTSPOT_STATE

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_WIFI_HOTSPOT_STATE
        Indicates the action of a common event about the Wi-Fi hotspot state, such as enabled or disabled. You can register this common event to listen for Wi-Fi hotspot state changes.

        In this common event sent to you, the WifiEvents.PARAM_HOTSPOT_STATE key of the IntentParams key-value pair carries specific information about the Wi-Fi hotspot state change, and the value can be WifiEvents.STATE_HOTSPOT_INACTIVE (Wi-Fi hotspot disabled) or WifiEvents.STATE_HOTSPOT_ACTIVE (Wi-Fi hotspot enabled).

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        WifiEvents.PARAM_HOTSPOT_STATE, WifiEvents.STATE_HOTSPOT_INACTIVE, WifiEvents.STATE_HOTSPOT_ACTIVE, Constant Field Values

      • COMMON_EVENT_WIFI_RSSI_VALUE

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_WIFI_RSSI_VALUE
        Indicates the action of a common event that the Wi-Fi signal strength (RSSI) has changed. You can register this common event to listen for Wi-Fi RSSI changes of the connected network.

        In this common event sent to you, the WifiEvents.PARAM_RSSI_VALUE key of the IntentParams key-value pair is associated with a specific value of the new RSSI.

        To subscribe to this common event, your application must have the ohos.permission.GET_WIFI_INFO permission.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        WifiEvents.PARAM_RSSI_VALUE, Constant Field Values

      • COMMON_EVENT_WIFI_SCAN_FINISHED

        public static final String COMMON_EVENT_WIFI_SCAN_FINISHED
        Indicates the action of a common event that the Wi-Fi access point has been scanned and proven to be available. You can register this common event to listen for the Wi-Fi scanning result.

        In this common event sent to you, the WifiEvents.PARAM_SCAN_STATE key of the IntentParams key-value pair carries specific information about the Wi-Fi scanning result, and the value can be WifiEvents.STATE_SCAN_FAIL (scanning failed) or WifiEvents.STATE_SCAN_SUCCESS (scanning succeeded).

        To subscribe to this common event, your application must have the ohos.permission.LOCATION permission.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        WifiEvents.PARAM_SCAN_STATE, WifiEvents.STATE_SCAN_FAIL, WifiEvents.STATE_SCAN_SUCCESS, Constant Field Values
